text: {0} stacks
empty
You have filled the map.
Contents tab to display on adaptive storage buildings:
That's the tab saying 'Contents' on the bottom left panel with a building selected. 'None' displays contents in the vanilla way through 'Select x' gizmos on the bar to the right instead of tab.
maximum number of stacks per cell
The maximum number of stacks that can go in a single space.  Buildings two-cells large will have twice as much storage capacity.\n\nNote that other factors may reduce storage capacity.
Drop specific count
total storage capacity
The maximum number of stacks fitting into this storage building for all cells combined.\n\n{sizeX} * {sizeZ} cells with individually set capacities.
The maximum number of stacks fitting into this storage building for all cells combined.\n\n{sizeX} * {sizeZ} cells with a maximum capacity of {maxItemsInCell} stacks per cell.
Automatically open contents tab
Selecting a storage building automatically opens its Contents tab with this enabled, or storage settings when empty.
Hide labels when zoomed out
Affects labels shown on the map, like [ count ] or Item xY. Only show them at a close zoom level when enabled.
Hide labels until mouseover
Affects labels shown on the map, like [ count ] or Item xY. Only show them when pointed at with the mouse when enabled. Overridden by the Toggleable Overlays mod when having that mod enabled.
Default label style
What to display for storage labels on the map. Individual buildings can override this in their config.
Maximum zoom level
The maximum zoom level to show labels for. They get hidden past this point.
Other items
Automatic
Automatically choose between item names getting displayed with their count when hidden and count only when having visible contents, either directly or through the building only accepting one kind
Total count
Display the total count of all items in storage in a format [ COUNT ]
Item names with count
Display item names and their count in a format of Item xY, one entry per line
Item names with count or total count
Display up to 3 item names and their count in a format of Item xY, one entry per line, or the total count when having more items
Item names
Display names of stored items, one entry per line
Item names or total count
Display up to 3 names of stored items, one entry per line, or the total count when having more items
Item names or name count
Display up to 3 names of stored items, one entry per line, or the count of different names when having more items
None
Do not display any labels
Vanilla
Display item counts individually on each item
